verses.kjv: The word which came unto Jeremiah from the LORD, when king Zedekiah sent unto him Pashur the son of Melchiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, saying,
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD when King Zedekiah sent Pashur son of Melchiah and Zephaniah son of Maaseiah the priest to him with this request:

verses.kjv: Enquire, I pray thee, of the LORD for us; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon maketh war against us; if so be that the LORD will deal with us according to all his wondrous works, that he may go up from us.
verses.ct: "Please ask the LORD on our behalf, because Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon is waging war against us. Maybe the LORD will perform one of his amazing acts for us and make him withdraw."

verses.kjv: Then said Jeremiah unto them, Thus shall ye say to Zedekiah:
verses.ct: Jeremiah told them, "Give this response to Zedekiah:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD God of Israel; Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, wherewith ye fight against the king of Babylon, and against the Chaldeans, which besiege you without the walls, and I will assemble them into the midst of this city.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD God of Israel says: Look, I am going to turn the weapons you are fighting with against you. The weapons you are using against the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans who are besieging you outside the walls — I will gather them all into the center of this city.

verses.kjv: And I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, and in fury, and in great wrath.
verses.ct: I myself will fight against you with a powerful hand and a mighty arm, with anger, fury, and intense rage.

verses.kjv: And I will smite the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast: they shall die of a great pestilence.
verses.ct: I will strike down the people living in this city, both humans and animals. They will die from a terrible plague.

verses.kjv: And afterward, saith the LORD, I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, and his servants, and the people, and such as are left in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those that seek their life: and he shall smite them with the edge of the sword; he shall not spare them, neither have pity, nor have mercy.
verses.ct: After that, declares the LORD, I will hand over Zedekiah king of Judah, along with his officials, the people, and whoever survives the plague, the warfare, and the famine in this city — I will hand them all over to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, to their enemies, and to those who want them dead. He will cut them down with the sword without holding back, without pity, and without mercy.

verses.kjv: And unto this people thou shalt say, Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I set before you the way of life, and the way of death.
verses.ct: To this people you must also say: This is what the LORD says — Pay attention, I am placing two options in front of you: the path to life and the path to death.

verses.kjv: He that abideth in this city shall die by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence: but he that goeth out, and falleth to the Chaldeans that besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be unto him for a prey.
verses.ct: Anyone who stays in this city will die by warfare, famine, or plague. But anyone who leaves and surrenders to the Chaldeans besieging you will survive — they will escape with their life as if snatching it from danger.

verses.kjv: For I have set my face against this city for evil, and not for good, saith the LORD: it shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.
verses.ct: I have turned against this city to bring disaster, not blessing, declares the LORD. It will be handed over to the king of Babylon, and he will burn it to the ground.

verses.kjv: And touching the house of the king of Judah, say, Hear ye the word of the LORD;
verses.ct: Regarding the royal household of Judah, say this: Listen to the word of the LORD!

verses.kjv: O house of David, thus saith the LORD; Execute judgment in the morning, and deliver him that is spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor, lest my fury go out like fire, and burn that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.
verses.ct: House of David, this is what the LORD says: Administer justice every morning, and rescue the victims of robbery from those who oppress them. Otherwise my fury will blaze out like fire and burn so that no one can put it out — all because of the evil things you have done.

verses.kjv: Behold, I am against thee, O inhabitant of the valley, and rock of the plain, saith the LORD; which say, Who shall come down against us? or who shall enter into our habitations?
verses.ct: Pay attention — I am against you, you who sit in the valley, on the rocky plateau, declares the LORD. You who say, 'Who could possibly attack us? Who could break into our strongholds?'

verses.kjv: But I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings, saith the LORD: and I will kindle a fire in the forest thereof, and it shall devour all things round about it.
verses.ct: I will punish you according to what your actions deserve, declares the LORD. I will set fire to your forests, and it will consume everything around it."
